messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Bruno,
>
> On 10/10/07, Bruno Felaco <cfelaco@...> wrote:
> > So why does the code cast the Class to a TestCase? It seems like
> > this is a case of overzealous use of the new parameterized types in
> > Java 5 and a regression from JUnit 3.
>
> I'd say merely mistaken, rather than overzealous. :-) Submit a bug
> report, and it should be easy to fix in 4.5.

Done. And I didn't mean to sound critical - being overzealous is no
crime in my book. After all, aren't you all test-obsessed? :-)

> > Also, in JUnit 3 the method loadSuiteClass() called getLoader() to get
> > the ClassLoader to use, which opened the door for extensibility. This
> > is gone now, why?
>
> Can't say the why. Can you open another bug, perhaps with a test
> you'd like to see compile and pass? Thanks,


I'm not sure this issue really is a bug. I suspect the move was
intentional, but I would recommend that instead of just removing the
getLoader() method, it should have been deprecated. As I mentioned in
the bug report, this came to light when attempting to use JUnit 4.4
with Cactus tests. I suspect this is just the tip of the iceberg of
the issues which I'm sure have already been investigated by others.

- Bruno
